verb.description: Take advantage of free parties, travel, or other benefits offered by companies for publicity purposes.
examples: instead of touring, the band spent all their time fighting and ligging

noun.description: A free party or show provided for publicity.
examples: I wasn't interested in ligs, or freebies, or expenses

origin: 1960s: from a dialect variant of lie, literally lie about, loaf, whence freeload.
